channel.title: Sprites
channel.description:
I'm wondering how to change the sprites of spells in a client. Any help would be appreciated.
~Phoenixx

item.title: Sprites
item.dc:creator: @bl4ck_ra1nb0w bl4ck ra1nb0w
item.description:
@bl4ck_ra1nb0w wrote:

[quote=“Exist2inspire, post:8, topic:151633”]firstly, its done in your client - not your server.

so in your client, find the file class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.JAVA and open it. add this in there:

else if (s.equalsIgnoreCase("PRAYERON") && i == 13)
{
try
{
				Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("./sprites/"+s+" "+i+".png");			//System.getProperty("user.dir") + "\\"+i+".png");	
				anIntArray1439 = new int[anInt1440 * anInt1441];
				PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new PixelGrabber(image, 0, 0, anInt1440, anInt1441, anIntArray1439, 0, anInt1440);
				pixelgrabber.grabPixels();
//System.out.println(s+" "+i+".png"+ " hopefully loaded");
			}
			catch (Exception exception)
			{
				System.out.println(((Object) (exception)));
			}
		}

just edit it to suit your needs. it’s pretty straight forward to understand so i wont go into much detail.

Btw, i took that from sanga’s sprite adding tut, you can find it here:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,192626.0.html

hope i helped.[/quote]

…
I just gave him a better way who said anything about a server?..

I told him to use a client that had sprites, and replace theirs with his.

Read full topic

firstly, its done in your client - not your server.

so in your client, find the file class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.JAVA and open it. add this in there:

else if (s.equalsIgnoreCase("PRAYERON") && i == 13)
{
try
{
				Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("./sprites/"+s+" "+i+".png");			//System.getProperty("user.dir") + "\\"+i+".png");	
				anIntArray1439 = new int[anInt1440 * anInt1441];
				PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new PixelGrabber(image, 0, 0, anInt1440, anInt1441, anIntArray1439, 0, anInt1440);
				pixelgrabber.grabPixels();
//System.out.println(s+" "+i+".png"+ " hopefully loaded");
			}
			catch (Exception exception)
			{
				System.out.println(((Object) (exception)));
			}
		}

just edit it to suit your needs. it’s pretty straight forward to understand so i wont go into much detail.

Btw, i took that from sanga’s sprite adding tut, you can find it here:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,192626.0.html

Read full topic

item.title: Sprites
item.dc:creator: @bl4ck_ra1nb0w bl4ck ra1nb0w
item.description:
@bl4ck_ra1nb0w wrote:

[quote=“Phoenixx, post:1, topic:151633”]I’m wondering how to change the sprites of spells in a client.
Any help would be appreciated.

~Phoenixx[/quote]

The easiest way is to get a client with sprites.

Then you do these easy steps.
[Note: Always have backup files]

  1. Open Your Client folder.
  2. Find the sprites folder [Note: must be a client with sprites]
  3. Find the Name of the sprite you want to change.
  4. Right click the file and click rename, copy the name, but do not change it.
  5. Take that picture out of the folder and put it in a different one for storage.
  6. Put the new desired sprite into the folder.
  7. Rename it to the sprite you took out.
  8. Compile.
  9. Run and notice the change of the icon.

Hope I helped.

Read full topic
